title: The Children Lead
outcome: A youth-led movement, catalyzed by the children of families harmed in the early BCI pilots, stages a citywide reverse trial, demanding accountability from former system designers and adults. The process brings a new perspective and energy to debates, forcing intergenerational reckoning and reshaping the city’s plans for governance and justice, as youth propose a new charter for Stenograd.

events.description: A group of teenagers leads an open-air forum, accusing adults and system architects of moral failure during the BCI era. Their testimonies resonate, and youth gather mass citywide support.
A series of youth-led reverse trials are held, with adults called to account for decisions tied back to early BCI pilots. Emotional confessions and public apologies follow, igniting intense debate.
Inspired by the momentum, the youth propose a new city charter focused on transparency, inclusion, and collective memory. The proposal is debated in neighborhood assemblies across Stenograd.
Adults and former Council members attend a final youth-led forum. They publicly commit to support the drafting of a new governing document with full intergenerational involvement.
A public vote is announced on adopting the youth-proposed charter, marking the first open, citywide democratic process in Stenograd since the BCI era began.
